channel.title: Avoozl
channel.description: A lightweight wiki-style database focused on personal curation, concise descriptions and minimal tagging.

item.title: Digital thunder
item.description:
Mega Man X3 is a 1995 side-scrolling platform game released on the Super Nintendo. It is the third title in the Mega Man X spin-off series and is notable for featuring Zeroâ€”a tenacious robot featured in the two previous gamesâ€”as a playable character.




ðŸ’Ž Credits and release

DirectorKeiji Inafune
ComposerKinuyo Yamashita
DeveloperCapcom
PlatformSuper Nintendo
MediaROM cartridge
Release dateDecember 1st, 1995




ðŸ“œ Logbook

Do you have fond memories or fun trivia to share about this game, its development or its place in history? Do tell!

item.title: Pixel perfect
item.description:
Mega Man 7 is a 1995 side-scrolling platform game released on the Super Nintendo. It is the seventh game in the Mega Man series and is notable for the addition of bolts that the player can find throughout the levels and exchange for items and power-ups at the Cybernetic Support Shop.




ðŸ’Ž Credits and release

DirectorKeiji Inafune
ComposerYuko Takehara
DeveloperCapcom
PlatformSuper Nintendo
MediaROM cartridge
Release dateMarch 24th, 1995

Do you have fond memories or fun trivia to share about this game, its development or its place in history? Do tell!

item.title: Hot embers
item.description:
Mega Man X2 is a 1994 side-scrolling platform game released on the Super Nintendo. It is the second title in the Mega Man X spin-off series and is notable for introducing an assortment of new power-up upgrades.

item.title: A cursed Elizabeth
item.description:
Castlevania Bloodlines is a 1994 side-scrolling platform game released on the Sega Genesis. It is notable for offering the choice of two playable characters and for featuring an evocative musical score.

item.title: Ten minus two
item.description:
Mega Man X is a 1993 side-scrolling platform game released on the Super Nintendo. It is the first title in the Mega Man X spin-off series and is notable for its technical design, colourful visuals and electronic rock soundtrack.

item.title: Diamond in the rough
item.description:
Aladdin is a 1993 side-scrolling platform game released on the Sega Genesis. It is notable for its use of hand-drawn art assets produced by Walt Disney Feature Animation as well as fluid motion and digitized sound effects.




ðŸ’Ž Credits and release

DirectorDavid Perry
ComposerTommy Tallarico
DeveloperVirgin

MediaROM cartridge

item.title: Rocket flight
item.description:
Mega Man 6 is a 1993 side-scrolling platform game. It is the sixth game in the Mega Man series and the last one released on the Nintendo Entertainment System. In this outing, the robot dog companion, Rush, can be transformed into either a power suit or a jet pack, effectively granting the player special access to otherwise unreachable areas.




ðŸ’Ž Credits and release

DirectorKeiji Inafune
ComposerYuko Takehara
DeveloperCapcom
PlatformNintendo Entertainment System
MediaROM cartridge
Release dateNovember 5th, 1993




ðŸ“œ Logbook

Do you have fond memories or fun trivia to share about this game, its development or its place in history? Do tell!

item.title: The sunset rider
item.description:
Shinobi III is a 1993 side-scrolling platform game released on the Sega Genesis. It is acclaimed for its graceful music score and the quality of its presentation. While a modest commercial success upon release, it has since been positively appraised and highly regarded as a classic of its time and era.




ðŸ’Ž Credits and release

DirectorTomoyuki Ito
ComposerHirofumi Murasaki
DeveloperSega
PlatformSega Genesis
MediaROM cartridge
Release dateAugust 22nd, 1993

Do you have fond memories or fun trivia to share about this game, its development or its place in history? Do tell!

item.title: Where the wind blows
item.description:
Mega Man 5 is a 1992 side-scrolling platform game released on the Nintendo Entertainment System. It is the fifth game in the Mega Man series and is notable for the addition of Beat, a robot bird companion that can be unlocked by collecting circuit boards scattered throughout the levels.




ðŸ’Ž Credits and release

DirectorKeiji Inafune
ComposerMari Yamaguchi
DeveloperCapcom
PlatformNintendo Entertainment System

item.title: Pyramid pathfinder
item.description:
Mega Man 4 is a 1991 side-scrolling platform game released on the Nintendo Entertainment System. It is the fourth game in the Mega Man series and is notable for the addition of the Mega Busterâ€”a powerful weapon shot that the player can charge and release onto their opponents.
